data.title: DUDLEY MOORE IS WAITING TO DIE SAYS WIFE; Health fears over Brit funnyman.
data.meta_description: Free Online Library: DUDLEY MOORE IS WAITING TO DIE SAYS WIFE; Health fears over Brit funnyman.(News) by "Daily Record (Glasgow, Scotland)";  News, opinion and commentary General interest

APA style: DUDLEY MOORE IS WAITING TO DIE SAYS WIFE; Health fears over Brit funnyman.. (n.d.) >The Free Library. (2014). Retrieved Aug 23 2024 from https://www.thefreelibrary.com/DUDLEY+MOORE+IS+WAITING+TO+DIE+SAYS+WIFE%3b+Health+fears+over+Brit...-a060563618

Actor and funnyman Dudley Moore is "waiting to die", his fourth wife has claimed.

Nicole Rothschild was asked about his health on an American TV show.

Rothschild, 34, said he had given up the will to live and felt "there was nothing left for him anymore".

She also said she was dropping a [pound]10million divorce claim against the 63-year-old star.

But mystery still surrounded Moore's condition last night after former wife Suzy Kendall, disputed Rothschild's claims.

Kendall, 53, who was divorced from Moore in 1972, even said he was in good health as far as she knew.

And she disputed a further claim by Rothschild that Moore was staying with her.

Yesterday, there was no answer at the London home Kendall shares with her current husband, a commodities trader.

But a handwritten note attached to the door read: "On behalf of Suzy Kendall - 1) Dudley Moore is not here, 2) When she spoke to him a few days ago he was not dying or wanting to die."

Whatever the truth, diminutive Moore's health problems have been known for many months.

Last year, he had open- heart surgery after his lifestyle as a fast-living, if unlikely, sex symbol took its toll.

His drinking and alleged use of pills contributed to his ailing health and he has suffered four strokes.

The former partner of late comic legend Peter Cook - who was also renowned for his reckless living - was said by his doctor in April to be gravely ill and unlikely to recover.

Moore, the star of movies Arthur and 10, married Rothschild in 1994, but the relationship was soon in difficulty. She accused him of assault and told of drug and sex parties at his beach front home.

In a lawsuit, she claimed he spent more than [pound]6000 a month on drugs and prostitutes.

He in turn said her allegations had wrecked his career.

The marriage break-up is also thought to have contributed to his ill health.

Rothschild's version of events prompted actress Prunella Scales, a close friend of Moore, to speak of her fears yesterday.

She met the 5ft 2in funnyman when he was a student at Oxford and said: "I'm very upset to find out he's not well.

"He must try to get in touch. If he's over here, I will try to get in touch."
